Package com.andybaba.games.card

Class BaseHand

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.andybaba.games.card.BaseHand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Hand, java.lang.Iterable<Card>
    public class BaseHand
extends java.lang.Object
implements Hand

    Class Hand:

    A basic class to represent a hand of Cards. Its essentially a wrapper for ArrayList Class to represent a hand of card.

    Since:
    Dec 11 2018
    Version:
    0.8.0
    Author:
    Andy
    See Also:
    ArrayList, Card, Hand

                Hand.Duplicates acceptDuplicate)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs a hand with a given maximum number of cards and if it can accept duplicated Cards or not
        Parameters:
        maxCards - Maximum cards a hand can keep
        acceptDuplicate - If the hand accepts duplicated Cards or not
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the maxCards is none positive value.

      • BaseHand

        public BaseHand​(int maxCards)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs a hand with a give maximum number of cards

        A hand by default does not accept duplicated Cards.

        Parameters:
        maxCards - Maximum cards a hand can keep
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the maxCards is none positive value.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add​(Card card)
         throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException,
                java.lang.ArrayStoreException
        Adds a given card to the hand. It will check the hasDuplicate flag, if the flag is false, it will not accept duplicated cards
        Specified by:
        add in interface Hand
        Parameters:
        card - The card to be added to the hand
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the hand is already full
        java.lang.ArrayStoreException - If the hand does not accept duplicate cards

        Throws:

        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • randomize

        public void randomize()
        Fills the hand with random Cards. If the hand is not empty already, it just does it for the remaining places in the hand with respect to the maximum size of the hand set when constructing the hand.

        If accept duplicates flag of the hand is set to yesit will randomize with unique cards

        Specified by:
        randomize in interface Hand
        See Also:
        BaseHand

      • contains

        public boolean contains​(Card card)
        Description copied from interface: Hand
        Checks if the hand contains a given Card. It returns true at its first occurrence
        Specified by:
        contains in interface Hand
        Parameters:
        card - The Card to look for
        Returns:
        true if it finds the card in the hand
